data.title: Cecil R. Workman « Penwell Turner Funeral Home
data.meta_description:
Cecil R. Workman, age 69, of Shelby, died at his home Tuesday, December 22, 2009.

He was born April 9, 1940 in Morehead, Kentucky the son of the late Van and Mary (Mann) Workman. Cecil was an Army veteran serving from 1962-1964. He was an employee of AMF in Shelby, Perfection Steel and Body in Galion and retired in 1996 from Copperweld in Shelby after 30 years of service. He was a member of the First Church of God in Shelby and Shelby American Legion O'Brien Post #326. He enjoyed fishing and woodworking.

He is survived by his wife, Judy C. (Post) Workman whom he wed on March 3, 1962; a son: Scot and Karen Workman of Shelby; 3 grandchildren: Amanda Workman, Allison Workman, and Eric Workman; 3 sisters: Isa Caskey of Jackson, OH, Elizabeth Hays of Shelby, Phyllis and Arthur Ingram of Shelby; a brother: George and Dorlena Workman of Morehead, KY. He was preceded in death by his parents, 2 grandsons: Karl Scot Workman in 1995, Jason Aaron Workman in 2002; 2 brothers; 5 sisters.

Visitation, Sunday, Dec. 27, 2009 from 2-5 PM at the Turner Funeral Home, 168 West Main Street, Shelby where funeral services will be on Monday at 10:30 AM conducted by Craig Vent. Burial will be in Oakland Cemetery in Shelby. Memorial expressions may be made to the First Church of God, Boy Scouts or Girl Scouts. On-line
Condolences may be made at
penwellturner.com
data.text:
*******************************************************************************

Family: Cecil Workman

Name: Karen Barnett, LPN Crestwood

Date: 09-12-23

Condolence:

Judy and family:

I was so saddened to hear of Cecil’s passing. May you know that many are praying for you and that your great memories will comfort and sustain you at this difficult time and through the Christmas season. God be with you always.

*******************************************************************************

Family: Cecil R. Workman

Date: 09-12-24

Condolence:

I worked at McDonalds for many many years and saw Cecil and Judy come in All the time. So sorry to hear about your loss. Our thoughts and prayers are with your family.

*******************************************************************************

Family: Cecil Workman

Name: Brooke Burkhalter

Date: 09-12-24

Condolence:

Judy and family,

I am so sorry to hear about Cecil. He was one of my favorite people to care. He was always smiling and asking how my children and family were doing. I was able to spend many days with him just talking. Know that he loved you all so much. He spoke of the grandkids so often and always smiled when talking about them. He will be missed greatly but we are rejoicing as he has reached his home and we have been given another angel to watch over us. Much love to you all!

Brooke Burkhalter and family

*******************************************************************************

Family: Judy, Scott and Karen

Name: Pam Sweeney

Date: 09-12-24

Condolence:

Dear Judy, Scott and Karen,

Thinking of you and your family and familes during

this time. I know you all will miss very much

cherish and remember all the good times and memories

you have.

You all are in my thoughts and prayers..

God Bless you Judy, Scott and Karen

Love,

Pam Sweeney

*******************************************************************************

Family: Cecil Workman

Name: Ann Cooper

Date: 09-12-25

Condolence:

Dear Judy and Family,

I am so sorry to hear of your loss. I will never forget the many years of Vacation Bible School at First Church of God and the many talks Cecil and I had while you and the other ladies were getting refreshments ready for the kids.

You will be in my thoughts and prayers and I am so sorry that I will not be able to come to calling hrs and the funeral as I will be out of towm. Judy please call if you need anything.

We know where he is and you will see him again one day.

Love, Ann Cooper

*******************************************************************************

Family: Cecil Workman

Name: Stephanie Payne Triplett

Date: 09-12-25

Condolence:

Judy, I’m so sorry to hear of Cecil’s passing. I did not know him personally but He always had a smile on his face when I seen him. may He Rest In Peace.

*******************************************************************************

Family: Cecil Workman

Name: Jean and Susie Metzger

Date: 09-12-26

Condolence:

You and Your family have our deepest condolences.

*******************************************************************************

Family: Cecil Workman

Name: Pearl and Harold Diller

Date: 09-12-27

Time: 21:52:00 -0500

Condolence:

Dearest Judy and Family,

Our thoughts and prayers are with you at this time. Cecil will be dearly missed. May you rest in God’s comfort and guidance until God’s timing reunites you with Cecil.

We would like to say a special thank you to Cecil at this time for serving our country in the Army, and doing his part to preserve our rights and freedoms.

*******************************************************************************

Family: Cecil Workman

Name: Michael & Beth (Patton) Knight

Date: 09-12-28

Condolence:

We are so sorry to hear of your loss. Jill had kept us updated on Cecil’s condition at different times in the last couple of years. Please know that our thoughts are with you.

Hugs,

Beth and Mike

*******************************************************************************

Family: Cecil Workman

Name: Jan Burton

Condolence:

So sorry to hear of Cecils passing. He always had a smile on his face. Know that he is in a much better place with God. I pray that God will comfort you with all the joy and good memories you have of him.

*******************************************************************************

Family: Cecil Workman

Name: Patricia Freeman

Date: 10-01-05

Condolence:

I’m so sorry for your loss. I hope you will find comfort in the following scripture:

Psalm 62:8-Trust in him at all times, O people, Before him pour out YOUR heart. God is a refuge for us.

My sincere condolences to you.
